column4: Hello! Can I change the default icons, so that pdf files get another image than openoffice files?
Any ideas how to have pdfs have different images than odts?
maybe someone can give me a pointer to a howto that explains how to make pdfs have different icons than odts?
can someone help me?
in windows its easy
Be patient :) I'm tying to remember
I remember now. The file type icons are attached to your theme. Some themes may have different icons for those file types, some may not
So in other words, there is no direct way to change it - you have to play with the theme
And if I wat to keep the Human theme, but change icons, that isn't possible?
It is, but you'll have to modify the theme
Just found this on goog.. http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-302549.html
How do I find the folder where my icon theme is installed?
!icons
I don't know. You can figure it out :)
because ~/.icons is empty
Or is it /usr/share/icons/Human with me?
So that I have to create /usr/share/icons/Human/48x48/mimetypes/gnome-mime-application-pdf.png ?
That doesn't work: I created /usr/share/icons/Human/48x48/mimetypes/gnome-mime-application-pdf.png
Oh. The instructions say to log out and in. I'll try
it didn't work
The icons are the same
is there anything else I can try?
What did I do wrong?
